items.title: Four investors including Swyom India Alpha Fund buy 3.56% stake in Jinkushal Industries on its market debut
items.description: Among four investors, Swyom India Alpha Fund has bought additional 4 lakh shares (1.04 percent stake) in Jinkushal at Rs 125 per share, amounting to Rs 5 crore.

items.title: Taking Stock: Nifty near 24,900 at day's high, Sensex up on buying in metal, banks
items.description: Nearly 180 stocks touched their 52-week high on the BSE, including Tera Software, Netweb Technologies, V2 Retail, L&T Finance, Lumax Industries, Jindal Steel, Goodluck India, Fortis Healthcare, among others

items.title: Bank Nifty recovers 400 pts from day's low, led by Axis, Kotak Mahindra Bank; here are the key triggers
items.description: Analysts said the Reserve Bank of India’s recent policy initiatives to boost credit growth supported sentiment in the banking space.

items.title: Goodluck India arm bags licence to make artillery shells, joins consortium to bid for AMCA fighter jet
items.description: In September, Goodluck India had entered into a Tripartite Memorandum of Understanding (MoU) with BrahMos Aerospace Thiruvananthapuram (BATL) and Axiscades Technologies for the development of Advance Medium Combat Aircraft (AMCA) programme.

items.title: There’s value in value stocks
items.description: There is more to life than growth and tech

items.title: Neutral Amara Raja; target of Rs 1030: Motilal Oswal
items.description: Motilal Oswal recommended Neutral rating on Amara Raja with a target price of Rs 1030 in its research report dated October 01, 2025.

items.title: Maruti Suzuki delivers 1.65 lakh vehicles in Navratri, eyes 2 lakh sales this festive season
items.description: This is the first time in a decade that Maruti Suzuki has topped one lakh deliveries during the Navratri days, reflecting strong demand. The auto major expects to sell 2 lakh vehicles in this festive season.

items.title: Tata Investment Corp shares rise 12% to hit fresh high, extend gains to 35% in 5 days, as Tata Capital IPO opens on Monday
items.description: Tata Capital, a non-banking financial company of the Tata Group, is launching its Rs 15,512-crore IPO on October 6, with subscriptions closing on October 8.

items.title: Wockhardt applies to seek USFDA nod for ‘miracle’ antibiotic Zaynich
items.description: The Mumbai-based company  is eyeing a US launch in FY27, marking a pivotal moment for Indian pharma innovation.

items.title: Nifty Metal index climbs 1.8%; Tata Steel, Nalco, Hindalco shares lead gains on positive global cues
items.description: Global cues turned supportive for capital-intensive sectors such as steel, with expectations of a U.S. Federal Reserve rate cut this month. The European Union’s reported plan to raise tariffs on imports may end up helping Tata Steel rather than hurting.

items.title: Subscribe for Tata Capital Ltd IPO; LKP Research
items.description: LKP Research, has come out with its report on Tata Capital Ltd. The research firm has recommended to “ Subscribe” the ipo in its research report as on October 01, 2025.

items.title: Nuvama Wealth rallies over 4 percent on Sebi's nod to sponsor a mutual fund
items.description: In January 2025, the company had informed exchanges about the application seeking approval to act as the sponsor for Nuvama Mutual Fund. This would enable it to launch mutual funds as well as Specialized Investment Fund (SIF).

items.title: Waaree Energies stock gains 3% as board clears Rs 8,175 crore capex for capacity expansion
items.description: Waaree Energies' largest investment of around Rs 8,000 crore will be directed towards scaling up the lithium-ion advanced chemistry storage cell and battery energy storage systems (BESS) plant from 3.5 GWh to 20 GWh.

items.title: Nifty Auto eases after 2-day rally as investors book profits on strong September sales
items.description: Despite robust September sales fueled by festive demand and GST cuts, auto stocks came under selling pressure on October 3, with the Nifty Auto index slipping after a two-day winning run.

items.title: WeWork India: Can the IPO ride the flexible workspace growth wave?
items.description: The company has emerged as a frontrunner in the flexible workspace segment

items.description: While price declines have been gradual rather than sharp, the consistency of the fall makes these stocks stand out in the midcap segment this week.

items.description: The consistent 3-day gainers on Nifty 50 are spread across a diverse set of sectors including defence, financials, metals, auto, FMCG, and pharmaceuticals,

items.title: Nifty Set To End Week Strong As Bulls Charge Towards 25,000 | Opening Bell Live
items.description: The Nifty 50 staged a strong comeback on October 1, rising nearly 1% to reclaim the 100-day EMA at 24,740 after eight straight days of weakness. Sentiment improved following the RBI policy announcement, but experts say the index must decisively clear 25,000- the midline of the Bollinger Bands and the 50% retracement of the recent fall-for a sustained upward move. Until then, range-bound action may continue with 24,600 as a key support level, defended for three sessions in a row. Stocks in focus today include Maruti, Hero Moto, TVS Motors, Coal India, and Sammaan Capital. Join Nandita Khemka live with Jay Thakkar, Head of Derivatives & Quant Research at ICICI Securities, and Vikram Kasat, Head of Advisory at PL Capital, as they decode the market outlook and the key trading levels to watch.

items.title: These smallcaps gain between 10-33% as broader indices outperform
items.description: All the sectoral indices ended in the green with Nifty PSU Bank index rose more than 4 percent, Nifty Metal index gained 4 percent, Nifty Private Bank index jumped 2.5 percent, Nifty Defence Index rose 2.3 percent, Nifty Oil & Gas index added 2 percent.

items.title: Market bounce back amid volatility; all sectors in the green
items.description: For the week, BSE Sensex and Nifty50 added 1 percent each.

items.title: Monetize Vega, the impact of implied volatility: Shubham Agarwal
items.description: Implied Volatility is the momentum input in the Option Premium. This is what defines how much of the expected move is priced into the Option Premium.

items.title: Dow, S&P 500 manage record closing highs; Nasdaq falls in volatile session
items.description: The Dow Jones Industrial Average rose 238.56 points, or 0.51%, to 46,758.28, the S&P 500 gained 0.44 points, or 0.01%, to 6,715.79 and the Nasdaq Composite lost 63.54 points, or 0.28%, to 22,780.51.
